skills.name: Given a situation sketch an appropriate real life graph
Interpret linear sections of real life graphs
Calculate the gradient on a linear section on a real life graph
Interpret the gradient on a linear section on a real life graph

explanations.A: The displacement is constant, meaning they are not moving. Consider what type of gradient on a displacement-time graph would represent a constant speed.
explanations.B: The time has not changed, but the displacement has shot up. Would this be possible?
explanations.C: The gradient here is increasing, meaning that they are accelerating. Consider what type of gradient on a displacement-time graph would represent a constant speed.
explanations.D: The displacement is increasing at a constant rate, meaning that they are travelling at a constant speed.

explanations.A: The graph shows the person's distance from the start is not changing, but time is passing. Therefore they are stationary, eg sitting on a bench.
explanations.B: The graph shows the person's displacement changing in an instant. Would this be possible?
explanations.C: The gradient here is increasing, meaning that they are accelerating. Consider what type of gradient on a displacement-time graph would represent someone being stationary.
explanations.D: The displacement is increasing at a constant rate, meaning that they are travelling at a constant speed. Consider what the gradient would look like to represent a stationary object.

explanations.A: A horizontal section on a velocity-time graph would represent constant velocity which is possible. A vertical section would represent an instantaneous change, and the object being in two places at once, so this would not be possible.
explanations.B: A vertical section would represent an instantaneous change, with undefined acceleration, which is not possible in real life
explanations.C: At least one of them is wrong. Think about what the gradient of a velocity-time graph represents.
explanations.D: At least one of them is right. Think about what the gradient of a velocity-time graph represents.

explanations.A: A vertical section would represent an instantaneous change, with undefined acceleration, which is not possible in real life
explanations.B: A horizontal section on a velocity-time graph would represent constant velocity which is possible. A vertical section would represent an instantaneous change, and the object being in two places at once, so this would not be possible.
explanations.C: At least one of them is wrong. Think about what the gradient of a velocity-time graph represents.
explanations.D: At least one of them is right. Think about what the gradient of a velocity-time graph represents.

explanations.A: The step took the full 10 seconds shown on the graph (time is on the x axis). Consider what is represented by the gradient (slope) of a displacement-time graph.
explanations.B: The height (distance) is actually measured on the y axis here. Consider what is represented by the gradient (slope) of a displacement-time graph.
explanations.C: The gradient of a displacement-time graph does not represent acceleration. How did we calculate a gradient of 4? Can you use these units to figure out what the 4 represents?
explanations.D: The gradient of a displacement-time graph represents speed. So her speed during this section was 4m/s

explanations.B: I think you have divided the displacement by the total time. How long in seconds did the negative sloping section of the graph last?

explanations.D: The gradient is calculated by dividing the change in y by the change in x. So (-8)/6 = -4/3
